contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Knappensee''' was a municipality in the northeastern part of [[Saxony]], [[Germany]], east of [[Hoyerswerda]]. It was formed in 1995 by the merger of the 3 municipalities [[Groß Särchen]], [[Koblenz (Lohsa)|Koblenz]] and [[Wartha (Königswartha)|Wartha]], and was named after the lake Knappensee. In 2004 it was disbanded. Groß Särchen and Koblenz became parts of [[Lohsa]], Wartha became a part of [[Königswartha]]. {{Coord|51|22|N|14|19|E|region:DE|display=title}} [[Category:Former municipalities in Saxony]]
